page.title: 12MANOR FARM, TOOT BALDON
page.content: Tiemen and Jennifer van Dijk rent 555 acres from Queens College and own 35 acres in Garsington. A dairy farm until 2 years ago, it is now a mixed, mostly arable farm with 90 beef cattle, 2 horses and 1 pony. Days begin at 7a.m. putting cows in with calves. After breakfast cattle are fed. At 8a.m. 2 farmworkers start their day and Tiemen usually works with them. Grass and maize silage is made. There are 5 public footpaths on his land. Farm vehicles include a combine harvester,5 tractors,and 1 pick-up. The present farmhouse is 200 years old. Part was burnt down after the war. It was recently modernised internally. Tiemen was born and raised in Holland, on a farm. He came to England in the 60's, married, had 2 daughters and moved to Toot Baldon in 1969. He is very active on farming committees.
